Setting Display Options in Visual Diff

If desired, you can change the tab settings used in Visual Diff, show or hide line numbers, display differences only, and display or hide the toolbar and status bar. In the Windows client only, you can also select a different font for the display.

To change the display options:

  1. In the Visual Diff window, select Edit > Options from the menu. The Options dialog opens.

  2. Click the Display tab.

  3. Determine which display options need to be changed.

  4. To adjust the tab size, enter an integer from 1 to 8 in the Tab size text box.

  5. To show or hide line numbers in the text and the printed output, select or clear the Show line numbers check box.

  6. To display the differences in the files, but not the matching text, click the Display Differences Only check box.

  7. To show or hide the toolbar and/or status bar, select or clear the appropriate check boxes.

  8. (Windows client only) To change the font displayed in the comparisons:

    1. Click the Font button. The Display Font dialog opens, showing text in your current font.

    2. Select a font from the Font list box.

    3. Select a size from the Size list box.

    4. Click OK. This action displays the Options dialog, which shows the name of the new font immediately beside the Font button.

  9. Click OK to confirm the selection on the Display tab.
